text: Preheat oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).  Cover a baking sheet with parchment paper.  Cream the butter, brown sugar, and white sugar using an electric mixer. Blend until the mixture is light and fluffy. Combine the dry ingredients in a separate bowl. Combine the flour, hot cocoa, salt, baking soda, and baking powder. Mix with a wooden spoon until the dry ingredients well-incorporated. Pour in the dry ingredients and blend on low speed for about two minutes, until the cookie dough is a dark brown and there are no flour streaks.  Fold in the chocolate chips and marshmallows. Mix until well-combined. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and allow the cookie dough to chill for about one hour.  Drop the cookie dough onto the baking sheet using a mini ice cream scoop. Place each ball of cookie dough two inches away from each other to avoid the cookies from spreading. Bake the cookies for about 9-11 minutes, until the marshmallows melt and the cookies slightly brown.  Allow the cookies to cool on a wire rack for about 5-7 minutes.  Serve. Place the cookies on a serving plate. Serve with a glass of milk or a mug of hot chocolate if desired. Enjoy!
